benchmark_details.name: LongHealth
benchmark_details.overview: The LongHealth benchmark is a collection of 20 fictional patient cases with detailed clinical narratives designed to evaluate the performance of large language models (LLMs) in medical question answering through 400 multiple-choice questions focused on information extraction, negation, and sorting.
benchmark_details.data_type: clinical case texts with question-answering pairs

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a more realistic assessment of LLMs in a healthcare setting, especially in extracting information from lengthy clinical documents.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark's use of multiple-choice questions does not fully reflect real-world clinical situations, which typically involve open-ended queries.

data.source: 20 fictional patient cases created by experienced physicians.
data.size: 20 cases, each ranging from 5,090 to 6,754 words

methodology.calculation: Mean accuracy is calculated over five runs
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better performance in extracting information from clinical documents.
methodology.baseline_results: Mixtral-8x7B-Instruct-v0.1 achieved the highest accuracy at 77%.
methodology.validation: Evaluated via multiple rounds of information retrieval tasks
